Package com.alexandriasoftware.swing

Class Validation

java.lang.Object
com.alexandriasoftware.swing.Validation
public class Validation extends Object
A Validation is the combination of a validation state and the tool tip to display on the validated component.
Author:
Randall Wood

    boolean
    equals(Object obj)

  • Constructor Details

    • Validation

      public Validation(Validation.Type type, String message)
      Create a validation with default preferences.

      This constructor should not be used within JInputValidator.getValidation(javax.swing.JComponent, com.alexandriasoftware.swing.JInputValidatorPreferences).

      Parameters:
      type - the type of validation
      message - the tool tip text

    • Validation

      public Validation(Validation.Type type, String message, JInputValidatorPreferences preferences)
      Create a validation with custom preferences.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of validation
      message - the tool tip text
      preferences - the preferences to use; must not be null

    • Validation

      public Validation(Validation validation, JInputValidatorPreferences preferences)
      Create a validation from an existing validation with custom preferences.
      Parameters:
      validation - the existing validation to base the new validation on; must not be null
      preferences - the preferences to use; must not be null

  • Method Details

    • getType

      public Validation.Type getType()
      Get the validation type.
      Returns:
      the validation type

    • getMessage

      public String getMessage()
      Get the validation message used in the tool tip for the validated component.
      Returns:
      the tool tip text

    • getIcon

      public String getIcon()
      Get the Unicode characters for the displayed icon.
      Returns:
      the icon text or an empty string if there is no icon to display

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Get the color the icon is displayed in.
      Returns:
      the color to use or the System text color

    • getFont

      public Font getFont()
      Get the font used to render the icon.
      Returns:
      the font to use

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Note two Validations are considered equal if getType() and getMessage() are equal (the display properties getColor(), getFont(), and getIcon() are not considered for equality).

      equals in class Object
